Review.Titre: Nextiva Motto : Dead last and fine with that
Review.Contenu: Nextiva's Software is in the minimum state of development necessary to keep them legally clear of fraud charges.  The app interface looks like a freshman coding project, missing most QOL features consumers of other VOIP services will mistakenly assume are included without even asking. To name a few.   Users cannot block callers.  Users do not have visual voicemail from the app.  Users can not join meetings from the app. Users cannot send or views Faxes from the app. The voice recording and fax features have separate portals both from the basic Voip App and from each other.  Users must maintain 3 browser logins to access the features you would expect from a single web application.   .   In summary, the company is a woke grift that buys very positive reviews from "reputable" media like forbes and business.com, tech crunch, etc.  Who boast of the company's  inclusive forward thinking values and business ethics.  Nextiva then uses the assumption of legitimacy these reviews put in the customers minds to hustle them into lengthy 3-5 year contracts.

Review.Titre: zero help with what was needed
Review.Contenu: I'm not sure your customer support know how to make changes to the schedule. Again, I can for help creating an out of office event for another holiday and it does not work...

The Nextiva service was not a good fit for our business - we simply need a phone solution that works without constantly trying to troubleshoot.  As a result, we sent an account cancelation request via email (per Nextiva instructions) on December 20, 2022.  Nextiva sent an email response indicating a case had been opened ("Your Case has been received and a member of our staff will review it and reply accordingly.")  The Case # is 01536843.  Despite several follow up phone calls where I end up being put on hold indefinitely waiting to speak to someone in "Customer Relations" and emails, there has been no response or acknowledgement our account has been closed.  Canceling service should not be this difficult - this is terrible customer service.

We have been dealing with the same issue since we got Nextiva where we switch our phones to an office meeting notice once a month but the phones still ring. It took a month for someone who knew what they were doing to call me and get this resolved. The supervisors WILL NOT call to help, they will only email and it causes more confusion and frustration because they repeatedly ask the same questions. The support member who helped me at the end was very helpful but every other person I interacted with up until then was not helpful at all. I would also note that the contracts between users and Nextiva need to be combed over (and make sure you open EVERY single hyperlink in the document) because you have to make sure and give plenty of notice to cancel service before your autorenewal date comes or you will be stuck with them for another term of their choosing.

Review.Titre: We are a small business and need an…
Review.Contenu: We are a small business and need an additional number on 2 cell phones to run our business. We were in need of an upgrade from Grashopper and the Nextiva Sales Agent promised us a service that simply dosent work. I paid for a year via a contract, upfront for 3 lines eventhough I only need to connect 2 devices via the app. The 3rd line was to give both cell phones TXT capability. I cant even receive phone calls let alone the ability to txt out. I have spent hours of time on hold waiting for "customer" service. I thought this would be an upgrade from Grasshopper and it certainly is not. I will be holding them accountable for not upholding their end of the deal.

Review.Titre: RUN away. Manipulative and lacking compassion and simple human decency.
Review.Contenu: Not sure where to start, this company was so kind and believable at first, they made us think we would be in a trial period. Within the first week we decided not to use the service as it wasn't quite the right fit, they refused to cancel the contract without a huge payment, and are now charging us monthly and we are not even using their service. Absolutely the worst, most manipulative experience I have had in my business dealings to date, with 3 different businesses that have a large call volume. They refuse, even now after we were very human with them, to budge at all. They continue to take our money and we are not even using their service. This company actually disgusts me and has no compassion for the human experience. I will adjust this review if they decide to rethink their treatment of us. I am happy to show all emails backing this up.

Review.Titre: Inconsistent Billing and Poor Customer Support - 1 Star
Review.Contenu: I have been dealing with Nextiva's phone service for a while now, and my experience has been highly frustrating. The issues began with the billing, as every month we were presented with a different amount, often higher than what we were expecting. Even after canceling half of our lines, we continued to be billed for them for 12 months.Attempts to resolve these problems were met with extended wait times and inadequate support. Whether through phone or chat, reaching customer service became an ordeal, often resulting in waits of over an hour.These experiences have culminated in a severe lack of trust and satisfaction with Nextiva. Inconsistencies in billing and the difficulties in reaching customer support have made our relationship with this company unsustainable.I urge potential customers to consider these issues carefully and explore other options before committing to Nextiva's services. The lack of transparency and support has made our experience with them one to avoid.

Review.Titre: Many issues has been reported over time…
Review.Contenu: Many issues has been reported over time and no resolution yet. Cannot get into Smart Topics, cannot make a system to send emails automatically, emails sent from CRM sometimes are not received by other party. Customer Service rep disconected remote session and phone call without any resolution.

onboarding was quite awkward and certainly incomplete. Slava did not know how to choose the numbers, and made me wait for hours before he figured out that the numbers are pretty much unavailable. Not sure if that's so. He did not clearly explain how to receive and send faxes in the app and online. What I understood there is an email I have to send the document that I intend to fax(?). Quite unusual. I am not sure he even gave me that email address to send documents to be faxed, let alone explaining sending and receiving settings. On top of all of this, I learned that texting was not even included in my plan, although Leif Pilegaard promised to match Ring Central rate for the service, which includes essentials: unlimited call, text & fax (and more, such as video conf., internal messaging, etc.). But, here we go! Promises are not kept in case of Nextiva's team, I guess. On top of that, I learned that Nextiva's app is quite incomplete/unfinished and still under development. Not a nice introduction. I thought it was similar to Ring Central. I need to share this kind of experience... Well, I am eating

My go live with Nextiva has been an absolute disaster.  The Amazing support team is anything but... I spent 6 hours today on the phone with 15 different employees.  I was hung up on twice (I assume this was by accident).  I also asked to speak with a manger 8 times, and was always told that none was available and that one couldnt call me back.Things to improve:1. Terrible Onboarding ExperienceI was promised an onboarding department to assist with new accounts.  I called a few days ago and a customer set up one phone.  We decided together that once my number was ported (today) I could call her department back to configure the other phones.  Today I was told by multiple people that they did not receive permission to transfer me to the onboarding department, even though I hadn't started using my account, because the agent a few days ago closed the ticket.  2. No one takes ownershipI was transferred a dozen times between the hardware and configuration department.  Apparently the phone configuration agents do not understand the hardware and the hardware agents do not understand configuration??  The first thought anyone has is to transfer and make my problem someone else's problem.3. Sales staff overpromisesWhen I spoke with Walter last week, he promised that you pride yourself on excellent customer service.   He told me he worked for the company multiple years and the company has great support. After speaking with 15 people I contacted Walter, who was a. Unable (unwilling) to escalate my case, b. unwilling to have a manager call me back and c. unwilling to reassign my to the onboarding department. 4. Not able to speak with a managerI asked 10 times today to speak with a manager or receive a callback.  All managers were busy.5. Upper management doesn't care.  I escalated my issues to upper management, who have yet to respond to my request to have a support manager call me back.  Its not surprising that upper management doesn't care, since their bad attitude and lack of response shows through all levels of their customer service.I want someone who is knowledgeable about the entire system to call me tomorrow (Friday) so I can finish setup.

The worst experience. After the contract was signed, they were going to help me download the software and set up the system for use. They charged me for a year and inspite of asking to cancel immediately they kept charging me. It took them over a year to finally cancel and they said they could only refund the last month. Absolute theives is what I think they are. They knew they did not provide me a penny's worth of service but still kept my money they charged for over a year. KEEP AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY AND SAVE YOUR MONEY!

Review.Titre: Did not address the issue and closed…
Review.Contenu: Did not address the issue and closed the ticket. Terrible service.

This company sucks!!! They take hours with you on the phone to fix a problem. When you call, they keep you on hold for hours while your phone service is down and missing potential client calls.PS: I just received the obligatory apology email from this company. I call B%$# Sh&%! Try getting through to this person???

Couldn't be worse. I signed up on 10/26 after meeting with a Rep and clearly discussing our needs. To the point where I showed him our phone system and he said "NO PROBLEM it will do the same." Big problem, 6 day's in and hours with tech support, I said this doesn't work and I need to cancel on 11/2. Today 11/21 I still have gotten Zero communications. I call in and am told I need to trouble shoot again with support after already spending HOURS with them and they can't refund. Nightmare of an experience and now I am out money because I was mislead. Not to mention I am inside the 30 money back guarentee. DON'T USE

Absolutely DO NOT sign up with this company. Read all these reviews!! I signed up, been trying to get it set up for over a month, I can’t port my business phone number so I’m unable to use the service, and now they tell me I can’t cancel unless I pay almost $300. GIVE ME A REFUND YOU SCAMERS!! Hopefully you are reading this before you’ve signed up if you aren’t then you are here to add your one star review to the pile. Booooooo Nextiva!!!!

Do not use this company! Or at least DO NOT ENTER A CONTRACT! You will be stuck with a terrible, difficult to use phone system that has many issues including terrible sound, echoes and glitches. The customer service was almost ok, but who wants to be on the phone every other week for another problem?? IT'S A PHONE! How difficult does it have to be? I have other things to worry about. And (the worst part) GOOD LUCK SWITCHING BACK!! GOOD LUCK- I ended up paying off Nextiva for the rest of the year just to switch back- I wish I would have read THESE reviews and not the fake ones on other websites before switching :(
The customerservice of Nextiva is dishonest. Zero services provided by them and kept on charging my card. They could never build the product they promised.

Review.Titre: I waited over 40 minutes to have an…
Review.Contenu: I waited over 40 minutes to have an online chat with a Nextiva representative.  The rep tried to help but didn't seem to know enough or understand enough to help me.  I asked chat rep if I could speak with someone on the telephone.  I was given a phone number which I called.  I waited over an hour for someone at Nextiva to help me on the phone.  I hung up in frustration.  This is NOT good customer service.  If I have any pull at my Firm, we will NOT be using Nextiva for future needs.

First of all, their customer support is an absolute joke. It's as if they go out of their way to be unhelpful and rude. Every time I called in with an issue, I was met with condescending tones and clueless representatives who seemed to have no idea how to resolve anything. It's almost impressive how consistently terrible their support is.But wait, it gets worse. Hidden charges seem to be Nextiva's favorite game to play. Just when you think you've signed up for a reasonable plan, they hit you with surprise fees that would make your head spin. It's like they have a secret menu of charges they unveil just to mess with you. If you're lucky, you might find out about these charges buried in the fine print of their terms and conditions, but good luck deciphering that labyrinth of deceit.Nextiva's penchant for hidden charges is just the tip of the iceberg. Their overall service is a mess of glitches, dropped calls, and outages. It's like they took a time machine back to the 1990s and decided to provide us with the technology of yesteryears. And don't even get me started on their outdated user interface – it's like navigating a maze designed by someone who's never used a computer before.In conclusion, I can't stress this enough – do not waste your time, money, or sanity on Nextiva. Their customer support is a masterclass in how not to treat customers, their hidden charges will drain your wallet faster than you can say "scam," and their service is a technological disaster. Save yourself the headache and look elsewhere for a reliable and honest business communications provider. Nextiva is a sinking ship, and you don't want to be on board when it goes under.

RUN! This company is a SCAMMER!! Did their free trial and none of the functions worked, even after I sat on the phone with three different members from their technical support for TWO HOURS and they couldn’t help me. The very next day I said cancel the trial I will not be moving forward because this company is clearly incompetent. They say on the phone with me and told me the account was canceled. Then one week later they charged me $40!!  I called for three days in a row and every teamMember gave me the run around lying and saying it was cancelled and it wasn’t!! I’m still sitting on the phone with them trying to get proof that it’s cancelled and and proof of a refund. They are SCAMMERS!! Take your money and time elsewhere!!!

Review.Titre: Good luck ever closing an account with…
Review.Contenu: UPDATE:  Less then 12 hours after this review I got a cancellation email.  Was that so difficult? Shouldn’t take this to do the right thing.  Good luck ever closing an account with them.  5 times now I have tried to get them to close the account and they do nothing but keep charging my Credit Card.

Review.Titre: When I first went to Nextiva
Review.Contenu: When I first went to Nextiva, they told me that I can text on my computer to cell phone numbers which is a LIE. Their calling features are quite cumbersome and not smart at all. If you enter a phone number with a 1 in front of it, it will not go through- it's not smart enough like cell phones to fix this itself. Also, the company locks you into a 18 month contract subpar service. Their customer service takes 30 minutes to pick up your call to tell you that someone will return your call with your issue and if you don't pick up the phone exactly when they call you, they will cancel your request and you have to submit a new request for whatever issue you have. They are quick to close ticket and slow to respond to them. I'd give NEXTIVA negative stars if I could. STEER CLEAR OF THIS COMPANY - use 8x8 instead
They were able to answer something related to the account but not help get me in contact with someone to fix it and I was waiting for 20 minutes or more to get ahold of someone on the chat.

" Nextiva was built on the idea that all businesses deserve better".....That is what you hear while you are on hold, I should know because I was on hold 1 hour, 35 minutes and 27 seconds before I was hung up...FOR THE SECOND TIME TODAY!  We have been trying to cancel this service since October 2022. Finally, Joshua, made some headway in getting this service canceled. He emailed me the cancelation form, via docusign, for me to sign and make our final payment, which is paying for the "free phones" they sent us.  After I put in our credit card information and signed the documents, the screen said THANK YOU and went blank.  He assured me that I would receive a conformation email shortly...we sat on the phone together for several minutes, he placed me on another hold, only to hang up on me.  Everything about Nextiva is BULLCRAP!  If I could give a "0" review, you bet I would.   I know Nextiva is going to reply to this review telling me how sorry they are and all that crap, and to email them at reviews at nextiva.com.  Only to get nothing back in response, this isn't my first rodeo with this company.

Review.Titre: Still waiting on my service request to…
Review.Contenu: Still waiting on my service request to be completed. I asked a simple task to change my billing plan, case is set up but not resolved as of now. It’s been 3 days

Review.Titre: I just signed up for service and…
Review.Contenu: I just signed up for service and Nextiva One is not working and I can't log into my account.

Review.Titre: What a difficult time I had
Review.Contenu: What a difficult time I had. Procedures and policies are very difficult to navigate. Even the chet had a difficult finding my account. Needs work for sure.

Review.Titre: I’ve been a customer of Nextiva since…
Review.Contenu: I’ve been a customer of Nextiva since 2009. They used to be a great company, super service, reliable support, etc. Three month ago I switch for their legacy Pactosis system to their lastest Nextiva One system, based upon what I perceived were more feature and better pricing that met my needs. The problem is their customer service has declined to what I consider TERRIBLE. They market their services as awesome but don’t believe a word of it. Their app on IOS for an iPhone or iPad does not work properly and it will not indicate when calls are inbound. It worked fine on my desk phone or on my Mac but not on the phone or iPad. I spent four hours on the phone over several days with their app team and got switched from person to person and then finally got someone that indicated this was a know problem that many customers were having.  You would think that everyone in the company would know this and not waste their customers time. I even email Tomas Gorny, their CEO and not even the courtesy of a response or anyone from his team reaching out. Ultimately my sales person got this escalated and I was assigned a escalation manager who acknowledged their problem and told me it should be resolved over two months ago and that he would keep me informed of their progress. Never received an email or call from him again. If i treated my customers this way I would expect to be fired! Don’t believe their marketing and don’t waste your time. I wish their customer support was what they used to have.
Technically support take 2 weeks just transfer phone number.

Issue after issue. The sales experience started off good but it took over a month to get replacement phones for our new office, due to an error caused by Nextiva. During that time communication and customer service was very poor and unorganized. I would not recommend Nextiva.

Instability.  Our licenses got "lost" and overall we're really not having a great experience rolling out advanced features.  It feels like there are 1000 great features Nextiva offers, but for some reason, they aren't available unless we contact support.

It was an ok service, but we aren't allowed to do much on our own.  Every time we needed to forward phones, it was a process.  We have now been trying to close our account for a week because that particular office is closing, but we can't get Nextiva to answer phone, chat, email....nothing!  That is why they are only getting 2 stars.

First, customer service agents were friendly and professional. No complaints there. That being said, Nextiva needs to get their systems and act together. Needed to change the credit card info on file for our account. I should be able to do this online. However, our dashboard is missing the key 'billing' link. That in itself is ridiculous. I called customer service. I talked with four different people, because each person I spoke with could not fix the problem and had to transfer me to someone else. They said that since we were an "old" customer, our dashboard was not up-to-date. Seriously? You can't get existing customers updated with the latest systems? I was told they would send me a link that would take me directly to the billing portal where I could change our information. Waited forever with each person, only to be told their system was having problems. Long & short - on the phone with them for and hour and a half and still did not get the problem resolved. I hate doing business with companies that make it difficult to give them money. Time to find a new phone provider.

Review.Titre: We could not print out our invoice
Review.Contenu: We could not print out our invoice. I chatted and was emailed a linked to update my credit card.Still could not print invoice. Called waited 30 minutes, was transfer asked to wait another 5-10 minutes to fix. I asked to just have my invoiced emailed and he did email it. Customer service the second time was fine, wait time was rediculous.

Review.Titre: Customer service takes a long time to…
Review.Contenu: Customer service takes a long time to get in touch with +> Hour, once connected the person then will read from scipt,

Review.Titre: Sales staff not in sync with customer…
Review.Contenu: Sales staff not in sync with customer service, back office and tech support.  Sales staff will say anything to get your business.  Problem is back office isn't on the same page.

We had a user who's physical phone could not receive calls. It took 3 hours to get it to work but, the desktop App is now not working. I called back again for desktop support another hour and it was fixed.

Review.Titre: No personalized setup or assigned rep…
Review.Contenu: No personalized setup or assigned rep to help assist.  They do a quick overview and tell you to do the rest yourself.
Having problems receiving calls after making changes to call flow. Problem not resolved.

Review.Titre: customer response to our calls went an…answered
Review.Contenu: customer response to our calls went an answered

Review.Titre: The sales rep told me when I signed up. That their customer support was much better then the competitor
Review.Contenu: The sales rep told me when I signed up, that he would be my personal customer support for the first 90 days, he messaged me almost everyday, until I signed up, then after I signed up, sometimes it would take days to get a response, and I was never able to reach him by phone, I had to call customer service myself, to try and resolve a lot of issues, of which it takes being on hold for 30 minutes to reach anyone, and always seems to be a language barrier, I hope it gets better, but it hasn't yet, we have had a lot of connection problems with the app, so I'm not sure we will continue with them, if it doesn't get better.

Review.Titre: the chat was fine but waiting times on…
Review.Contenu: the chat was fine but waiting times on calls is forever

I don't know how this company obtained favorable reviews, but the service this company provides is awful!!! On average, I spend about 3 hours on the phone with customer tech support. Although the cost for phone service is low, the savings does not justify the time lost with incompetent techs. I am stuck in a 3 year contract with this terrible company. caveat emptor.

Review.Titre: I am a 8 year customer of Nextiva constant tech support issues.
Review.Contenu: I am a 8 year customer of Nextiva.  Overall the feature list is very comprehensive as well as having a good pricing structure.  The problem in my opinion is poor reliability and support.  Almost without exception my tech support call is more than 60 minutes and usually requires multiple calls to fix somewhat easy problems.  For example, phone extension configurations not maintaining their settings.  Also tech support is handles out of the Ukraine which can be a problem when explaining the problem and or getting issues resolved.  I suspect that is why I am tied up on the phone for 1-2 hours trying to resolve problems.

Review.Titre: Michael was great.He was tremendous in…
Review.Contenu: Michael was great.He was tremendous in solving proplem. The 2 Stars are for Company not Michael. I spent 2 hours on 12/19 to solve not getting all of my customers' incoming calls for 3 months. I merged 2 offices with multiple numbers and only partial message receipts from the Company. I discovered over 100 back messages in a call group of which I was unaware. When my account was set up 09/01/19, I should have been provided the email backup/extra step which Michael provided today. I lost 10 customers and $7000.00 in revenue since the poor and inadequate initial setup of my account, in addition to multiple calls and time to reach a solution.
Very poor.Software full of bugs and staff don't know what they're saying.To their credit, cancellation was easy with no nagging which is why they don't get 1 star.

We've been with Nextiva for years and within the past year they lost ownership of 3 of our phone lines and we had to get new numbers and redo all of our marketing materials which is super expensive.  No refunds, no customer service, horrible experience.  RUN FAST, anyone is better than Nextiva.Wow, so Nextiva responds quickly to reviews but not to customer service requests, how fitting!  Just confirms how bad they are at dealing with actual issues.  And you can't find my account?  Good Grief!  That's just a joke.  My account has been with the same email I used for this review.  Quit the lies Nextiva.I've also filed with Better Busines Buruea.  Anyone interested in Nextiva should check out how many claims are against nextiva with BBB.UPDATED Nov 2019 - Nextiva did give me a refund for the hassle I had to endure.

Review.Titre: STAY FAR AWAY IF YOU NEED PHONES FOR WORK
Review.Contenu: Nextiva sales make the system sound great.  Once they make the promises and get the billing set up, sales will not return a call and rarely responds to email. Once set up with plan, phones were shipped to us and we were told just hook them up and we will be fine.  Being a small professional office, we do not have dedicated IT, or time to mess with that.  It took weeks to get installation added, at additional cost.  Their "installation" was a fraud.  After more delays, we were finally told they could not find anyone, so we were back to square one.  Once we got all the phones hooked up, we had myriad glitches--like our night attendant not working, our passwords needing constant reset, etc.  Now our contacts are a black hole.  Still cannot get refund for installation charges, or even the first two months of "service" where we never made a call.

Anticipating the annual renewal, I telephoned Customer Service 3 days before my renewal kicked in and discovered their deliberate attempt to make cancellations hard.  My first call, I was told I must speak with a special department that handles this and they are CLOSED.  My 2nd call I waited 40 minutes to get to general Customer Service, only to be told, the department I need to speak with is VERY busy (Naturally, as everyone else is trying to cancel).  They suggest I leave my # and I will get a call back.  Of course 48 hours later, NO call back.  My 3rd call again a long wait to get to Customer Service and told the special team that I need to speak with has an extended wait time, but I am free to wait.  I waited 40 more minutes and after a grilling interview of WHY I WANTED TO CANCEL, I was told that my "request will be submitted".  Their deliberate ploy to make it difficult to cancel has been duly noted and I will go to great lengths to make sure this negative review is posted everywhere on social media.  SHAME ON YOU NEXTIVA.

I left Google Voice to be 'saved' by Nextiva. This is because Nextiva has a lot more features. But I'm not pleased with Nextiva either. I don't know why people boast about their support. Nextiva support lacks tremendously. Good support doesn't entail a support phone number. Good support entails proper setup, proper comprehension and getting things done right the first time. Their sales department is flawless. But as soon as you pay for services, you realize that you are kind of on your own. It takes forever to port numbers out. You have to create tickets and reach out to support for every part of the setup, it's simply not seamless or white glove to any degree. There's nothing cohesive about the company. It's like you need to deal with a whole new platform for each feature. Like SMS, recording voicemail, etc. They have a LONG way to go for their platform to be adequate. NOTICE! Their mobile app is complete garbage. You CANNOT run your business through their mobile app. It works 1/4 of the time and has list of bugs from NY to Mexico. It's mind blowing that they onboard customers to an app so deficient. Do they not understand that phone calls are an integral part of running a business? Anyway, so much more to say, but I need to go. I'm switching providers yet again and I'm not even one month in. Horrible experience.

I've been with Nextiva for about 2 years now and initially they were great. Customer service and the support team was very responsive when we called in and resolved any issues we had quickly. When our company started growing and began adding extensions we opted to transition from a month to month plan to a 3 year contract so that we could receive discounted pricing. Nearly a month and a half later Nextiva has not transitioned us to the contract and we are paying nearly $100.00 more per month because of it. We've called to follow up on our request at least 8 times and each time we're told someone will call us back to take care of the request and that our ticket has been escalated to a manager but yet no manager calls back. This makes me question the integrity of this company and it's advertising. The "Amazing service" they coin themselves on leaves much to be desired. Will be looking for another service provider who can stand behind their customers.UPDATE 3/10/20: It's been over 2 weeks since I wrote this review and wanted to provide an update. I did receive a message and email from one of the managers at Nextiva however response time back was slow (days) and resulted in no resolution. Emails back and forth asking if a contract was sent to me and then no response and no contract. Tier 1 support is much better than those that supervise them at this company. Unfortunately, Tier 1 support doesn't have the authority to implement contracts. Something is seriously not right here. Do your research and select your phone provider wisely.

Review.Titre: We do appreciate the quick responses
Review.Contenu: We do appreciate the quick responses. Anytime I leave a message I get a call back that day. We disliked the lack of knowledge that the phones needed WIFI adaptors, sold separately for them to work. We've had the phones for over a month not able to use them.

Horrible customer service.Although they have a Scotsdale, AZ address they work out of Central Europe.The turn around time for problem solving is about 48 hours.I am trying to get a simple log in password changed and it has been a nightmare that has now spanned almost 5 weeks!Addendum:  after I posted this review and received the response from Alex I did get the issue resolved.  However, it still did take 5 weeks.

We called support and were told there is a problem with our licenses. However, support could not help us and we were directed to call our agent who is not at the extension I've been calling for years and no one told me that. So, I have to sit on hold for a support rep again who told me that there is team support number now that answered on first ring and was great. Problem is that no one told me that so I had to call support twice and sit on hold for an hour.
the pin its not necessarytoo much trouble to change card for paymentwebsite very confused

Review.Titre: Everyone I spoke with was very professional and knowledgable.
Review.Contenu: Everyone I spoke with was very professional and very knowledgeable. The only reason I did not provide a stellar review is that the processes within Nextiva are so stove piped that there was not a clean handoff between personnel and I ended up duplicating activities with each person. It would be a huge improvement if an agent would stay on the line when making a transfer to another agent. Provide introductions. And explain what has already been accomplished. My time is valuable too!!!!It seems that Nextiva is more interested in keeping their support productivity numbers high than they are in solving issues in an efficient and timely manner.

Their setup is not intuitive.  Online support is also not intuitive unless you know their jargon. Response to support requests can be slow.The actual phone service has been good. Features are useful and allow flexibility.  But don't try to change something once it is set up.  You may cause disruption in other areas. and lose functionality and then have to go to support to get it rectified.
Did not meet expectations I wish you were given the change to try product before purchasing…

While support staff worked diligently to understand and fix my issue, the fact that they can not explain why my system was totally rerouted or changed from how it was set up and working for the last 10 years is a little bit of a bummer.  It sure caused major issues not having phones work at the store for the last few days.

For the most part, I like how everything works. The customer service is pretty prompt and helpful, and generally, I like our service. What I don't like is how unreliable our fax service is, and we have to constantly unplug our fax bridge and plug it back in as it goes out almost weekly, sometimes multiple times a week, which is a huge issue for a doctor's office that operates on paper charts only. The next issue I am having is every time we get a call, sometimes, it takes 5 seconds for someone to be able to hear me after I pick up, which can be frustrating and has resulted in patients hanging up.

Review.Titre: Account Manager Himself Should Get 5 Stars
Review.Contenu: The only reason I gave such a high score was because of our account manager, Travis Branham.  He has, unknowingly, talked me out of switching to a new company a few times.  The system is very difficult to follow and many times I've been on the phone for over an hour while a tech tries to set something up. Travis does all he can to take care of problems that I've brought to him.

I was on the phone for over 2 hours, transferred 5 different times to different departments to get to the root of the issue I was having. I was simply trying to reduce the cost of our bill or change plans. Different team members told me conflicting information. All team members were very kind, however, I felt bounced around and being on the phone for too long to resolve what we thought would be a simple issue.

Nextiva as a phone system works, however it's quite difficult to manage. From an IT perspective:1. There's no way to generate an extension list2. When you delete an account, then the employee returns the old account still exists in the system and can't be reused3. The restrictive licensing means that accounts need to be renamed to people who take over their positions, but if someone does that or gets married it's impossible to re record somebody's name without talking to support.4. When you try to create an account without licenses left, you're told that there's an error making the account and to try again later.If you have more than 10 users and need to manage a large number of extensions I would recommend against Nextiva until some significant fixes are made on the back end. Support is helpful and prompt.

Review.Titre: Took ALOT of our time & effort - Hopefully will have been worth the effort
Review.Contenu: I liked that everyone was very nice to deal with.We feel very strongly that there should be an onsite Nextiva employee at some point in the transition.  We were transitioning 3 businesses - 2 from Vonage - 1 from Verizon.  There's many moving parts and it just took A LOT of our time to make this happen.  For a service we are paying for - there should a minimum onsite employee for guidance.  We wouldn't have moved to Nextiva if we didn't see it bringing an ease of running our businesses that we didn't have before so let's hope 3 months from now that all the time and energy put into it pays off & we love the system!

It took much longer (weeks) than originally planned. We were told it was because the implementation person at Nextiva went on vacation/off and the work could continue by an interim person. We chose to wait for the person to come back.

Review.Titre: I think the employees did their best to resolve the problem…
Review.Contenu: I think the employees did their best to help me but the problem that cost us hours was an "s" was added to my last name when converting to the new system from the old one and being my pin number was hard for me to recall, someone could have said try the last 4 numbers in your XX number. I had painstaking exercises in Identifying myself even though It was just done on a different account. The second account was created by Nextiva in 2011 and have been charged an annual premium each year. Although I periodically checked the renewal email, I never caught the 4/19 billing every year to my bank account. If so I would have addressed this years ago. My suggestion with everyone is to check everything. To process to correct this is in motion so we will see how it comes out. So employees good, prior mistakes, costly.

Review.Titre: Things finally got resolved when after…
Review.Contenu: Things finally got resolved when after multiple attempts over multiple days and weeks to connect with the right support person, our phone service is back online today after more than 20 days at a hard stop. Jason was the kind of guy that was not going to let us go another day without business phone service. He was able to push up the line to Robert the "advanced support" manager. He made it all work beautifully with Jason's insistence. Keep these two guys Nextiva as they got it done! Next time you get the run around for 20 days... insist on " the advanced support manager"

Review.Titre: The Nextiva vFAX system is very easy to use but...
Review.Contenu: The Nextiva vFAX system is very easy to use but the onboarding was pretty clunky and not user friendly. Seemed that it could have been done easily via an on-line system.  I wasn't expecting that I would have to talk through the process with an support person.

Review.Titre: They were able to help me with my…
Review.Contenu: They were able to help me with my request of editing extensions for employees who have left our company. I really thought it should be something I would be able to do but evidently it was not.
Still learning the whole system - What would make it better - when you open up "help" you have to work from that screen - if you hit a link - you are directed to your help session dissapears.

Review.Titre: The start of the call didn't go well
Review.Contenu: The start of the call didn't go well.  I could not understand what he said his name was.  After that, he said that my name was not on the authorized list.  I asked to speak to someone else, there was a pause and I guess he found me.  I introduced the 2 topics for the call.  One topic he fixed (I sure hope it doesn't break something else) the other topic he argued with me about how Nextiva doesn't offer a service that I was following up.  I decided to drop the topic and reach out to our rep.  I just didn't feel like my tech wanted to help with my options from the start.

Review.Titre: Nextiva needs improve on the CCX 500…
Review.Contenu: Nextiva needs improve on the CCX 500 phone, mic occasionally works and NextivaOne app missed call count can not be deleted all at once.

We transitioned to Nextiva from a similar platform. We were told Nextiva was the best, and was a more secure solution for us. However, this has been what I would call a clunky transition. For at least a week our call flow was not working properly, and I am still not 100% satisfied with the function of a few things.

Review.Titre: I have been asking for help to install…
Review.Contenu: I have been asking for help to install and configure the CRM for more than six months and no one returns the call, no help by phone or emails.  I have contacted Kiersten Shehadi, Katie Austin, Danielle Harris and especially Kristi Poehls who is not helpful at all and does not give me a solution.  I have a business with twenty-three telephone lines and with future expansion to acquire 20 more in the next six months and they treat me like the worst of their clients.  I have opened cases in the CRM department and they tell me that they are going to contact me by email and nothing.  I recommend you not to do business with this company, the lack of communication would generate losses and if your account is managed by Kristi Poehls, I would wish you luck because she never takes calls and even less would help you by emails.

Review.Titre: Great Account Manager ... Not So Great Support
Review.Contenu: Honestly, it's been rocky the past several months. One of our biggest issues is with the new NextivaOne App. We lost much of the simplicity and functionality of the old app. It's not been a smooth transition at all. Several of our employees refuse to switch to it until they absolutely have to. The other big issue is we are unable to call some customers and prospects because their phone number gets stuck in porting it out of your system. And it literally takes DAYS to get that fixed. It's a very frustrating and time-consuming process. We are a sales and customer service company. To be unable to contact our prospects and customers is totally unacceptable. Also, wait times for both phones and chats are ridiculous. I've waited up to 40 minutes to talk/chat with someone. On the positive side, our account manager, Jason Quist is fantastic. He's responsive and truly concerned about getting our issues resolved. Unfortunately, he can only do so much. It seems once an issue gets to the support side, things go downhill. I hope this is a temporary situation as we've been with Nextiva a long time and really don't want to switch. Thank you for being open and receptive to feedback.

Review.Titre: Technical help very good - Wait time bad
Review.Contenu: The help I received was very good and they were very patient with me.  However, I had to wait 40 minutes on hold to talk to someone.

Review.Titre: This product is not working and I can't…
Review.Contenu: Original review-This product is not working and I can't seem to get help.Since the review was left, I have gotten help and we are working together to get the program figured out for my company. I am very hopeful.I am happy to have the help and I hope that for future people don’t have to leave a 1 star to get a reply or help.

Review.Titre: The agent was super friendly and…
Review.Contenu: The agent was super friendly and helpful!It took roughly half an hour to get assistance, which seems to be the average between phone and chat support. There are so many issues that we don't bother to report, because they go away on their own before I can even get ahold of anyone, and they specified that they are overwhelmed today because they had an outage, which is true, and was experienced by our business. There are many issues with the new NextivaONE app, usability, reliability, etc. Additionally, there have been many issues where a device or feature isn't working properly, the error message seems to point to a setting that was not set up properly, and yet when we contact support they seem to be the result of back-end malfunctions. For example, we have assigned a license to the user, but are receiving the error that there is no valid license, only for support to quickly solve the issue. Support staff is always very helpful, positive, and friendly. But you will have to contact them for things you shouldn't have to contact them for, because the changes you make to your account through their online portal are not always successful.

Review.Titre: Needed a tier 2 support to cover my…
Review.Contenu: Needed a tier 2 support to cover my config. needs Still took almost 1hr to get to the right person. She did great. Been trying to get phones right for over 2 weeks now.

Review.Titre: Too long on hold to reach live…
Review.Contenu: Too long on hold to reach live representative. But amazing support once I did. Worth the wait.

Review.Titre: I do love Nextiva but this particular…
Review.Contenu: I do love Nextiva but this particular day it took quite some time to get the help I needed.
I am not really sure when things get switched over...how to use any of the system. If I even put the numbers in correctly...

Review.Titre: It takes too long on the phone to solve…
Review.Contenu: It takes too long on the phone to solve simple issues. Over an hour for each call!

Review.Titre: Agent did not seem to know what they…
Review.Contenu: Agent did not seem to know what they were doing. Took too long.

Nextiva is/was marketed as a competitor of RingCentral.  However, after a few months of using their product (specifically the web-based phone system) we've noticed the dependability and user friendly experience isn't quite where it needs to bet yet.  We have been kept in the loop with updates to the products and happenings in the company, which is nice, but just doesn't make up for a few pitfalls thus far.

Overall I really like Nextiva, for being able to get faxes on my computer and receiving incoming calls. However, 90% of the calls I receive are Spam calls. Nextiva recognizes them as spam about 10% of the time. Also, the call log does not decrease on the screen unless I log out and back in. Tech services is unable to fix it. The other thing that I don't like is that you must sign up for three years. My business has closed and still have to continue paying for over two more years.

Great until they do updates. Just lost all my contacts and feature that helped me track text dialogue with my customers. Customer support trying to help but they seem at a loss too. 😣. They also can't figure out why the Nextiva number does not show when texting. Glitch sent all text from my private number...now clients are calling me on that number. It's all a mess.

It was an okay experience. I felt there should have been a little more engagement with this being my first time using Nextiva. I really did not know what questions to ask... I was asked "what questions do I have?" Overall Igor was polite and he was mindful of my time. I appreciate it. Future... feedback have questions established for newcomers.

I just spoke with my original Nextiva sales person, who listened and was courteous.  He promised to review with supervisors and get back to me.We agree that this has been a bad misunderstanding.  Stuff happens and I was pretty upset, but seems like there is progress towards resolution.  Hopefully it can be resolved soon.

Review.Titre: I like that each step of the customer…
Review.Contenu: I like that each step of the customer process from the first phone call through to the email follow up survey, it’s all managed in Nextiva. Data is tracked accurately and we don’t have to do manual updates as it’s highly automated. It saves a huge amount of time.

Review.Titre: They insist that I stay on the line while they work.
Review.Contenu: I have been a customer for a few years.  Call quality has been just fine.I needed to make a conference call.  The feature didn't work.  I called support.  After spending 45 minutes on the phone while they tried to get it to work, I had other things to do and asked them contact me when it was fixed. No Go.  They insist that I stay on the line or they will not work on it.I am not helping them fix it and I have other things to do than listen to them try to get their system to work.The only thing that I can compare this to, is if you take your car to the mechanic to have something repaired and they say to you "Please stand next to your car while we work on it... this might take a couple of hours"Looking for a new service.

Aren was successful in setting my application up for SMS. While he was successful I would also say he seemed impatient with me and a tad put out that I was not as devise literate as he would like me to be.
Nextiva is a good company

Review.Titre: I did work with them for a while and…
Review.Contenu: They won't let you port your number to another carrier. I did work with them for a while and the customer service was ok. When I wanted to put my account on hold they made me jump through hoops for ever with several phone calls and unnecessary steps, plus they made me pay for it, $15 a  month to keep my account active. Then when I called, they said that they wont let me use my number because I would have to pay an extra month to activate it so that they would give me the "right" to port the number. They finally helped me out after I put a bad review of them. Then they called me every single day to "fix my issue" so that I would remove my bad review. I told them I wouldn't do it until the process of portability was done and they still called me and emailed me every day. Why didn't they care about my problem BEFORE I put the bad review?
I have been using Nextiva for a few months now and the service is great. However I have the the package deals are very pricey compared to others in the VOIP market.

Review.Titre: Avoid Nextiva. Over promise and under deliver.
Review.Contenu: Beware, our Nextiva sales rep promised VOIP features which apparently do not exist.  They ported over our number, customers received an out of service message for the first day until we called in to report it and something was changed. The next day we had to call in again just to get our phone voice system working again.Texting is very important to our business.  We repeatedly voiced our concerns and needs regarding texting both verbally and in writing.  We were assured that texting and the texting features we requested were going to be implemented on launch day.  Since the day of the port, they neglected to tell us that texting was not set up.  We discovered that texting was not up from complaining customers.  We asked them to correct this but it could not be completed for another 4 days since the weekend was coming and it could not be done until Monday or Tuesday.  Forget all of the texting features we were promised, those don't actually exist.  Now we would settle for basic texting. It has been a disaster.  The "local" customer service is actually from the Ukraine when it is after hours, the weekend, or the call center is full or whatever reason you can think of.  Only go with Nextiva if your businesses a hobby and you have no calls for a month during the set up process.  Even then it may not be worth the effort and calls to customer service to try and make it work.

Review.Titre: Issue was understood and resolved quickly
Review.Contenu: Issue was understood, and a resolution offered within a few minutes. Agent was helpful and concise, and put up with my confusing questions, but once he understood them, they were answered. Thank you!

Review.Titre: Nextiva Care is nice and helpful
Review.Contenu: Nextiva Care is nice and helpful. I was passed on several Analyst and I'm happy that Paige F. and the other guy I spoke to this morning assisted me very well. They are both good at answering my questions and providing clarifications.

Review.Titre: Well at first it wasn’t all that great…
Review.Contenu: Well at first it wasn’t all that great I was told that my application didn’t make it through your security check. I got an email telling me my case was closed. I called one of your representatives and here at office email that I never received that my account was approved and so on and so on so we set up the account that wasn’t smooth sailing
Great customer service.  Not the clearest and easiest to setup but much better than others.

My onboarding pilot, Anastasiia Pavlenko, was phenomenal. She was thorough, patient, kind, and had a good sense of humor. She made sure all of my questions were addressed. She did not try to rush the process, instead, she was very careful to ensure everything I needed was provided in detail.

Review.Titre: Great service and Tech Support - Affiliate Broker
Review.Contenu: The customer service and tech request was handled exceptional.  I would reccomment Nextiva to anyone who wants to increase their business...Larry Cunningham, Affiliate Broker,Monarch Realty Group, TN

Have been using Nextiva for over a year and with company growth wanted to expand - ordered 2 additional phones and lines and something occurred with shipment.  Had to contact a higher rep which got involved (my sales guy did not respond) but this guy did.  He came thru and made sure everything was taken care of immediately.

Seamless onboard at sales. The process of completing the process on the website was somewhat fragmented as the rep was not sure, at some points, where to navigate on the page. Overall, a very positive experience to start the service

Review.Titre: Finally a CS Rep that could help me.
Review.Contenu: I am pleased to report that my long-standing issue has finally been resolved. After a year of unsuccessful attempts and frustrating calls, I gave up. However, Nick at CR proved to be a fantastic and accommodating individual to work with. Despite my initial frustration at hearing the same thing that was previously said, Nick quickly resolved the issue. While I am grateful for Nick's assistance, I cannot help but feel that I could have saved more money if the CR representatives I spoke to earlier had handled the situation as efficiently as Nick did. Overall, I give Nick and CR 4 stars for their excellent service.

Review.Titre: OMG..how does Nextiva get high ratings
Review.Contenu: OMG..how does Nextiva get high ratings. Honestly, we had serious issues when they moved to Nextiva-One. It took several long phone calls over several weeks to fix. Finally, they escalated our case, worked on it for a whole day. Now everything is working fine going on a week now with no problems. It's the customer service that gets them high ratings.  Thanks Nextiva

Review.Titre: The Tech Support team was very helpful…
Review.Contenu: The Tech Support team was very helpful and went above and beyond in helping me with my issues.

Alex was very helpful, she listened to my concerns and addressed them the best she could.  We are a new customer, and some of our phone equipment was not shipped out.  That is not a reflection on Alex, but it is an inconvenience to us, as we are using our personal cell phones for business needs and the ease of transferring calls, checking messages, and recognizing calls is not as efficient as we'd like.

Review.Titre: Passed off to 3 people but last one was best.
Review.Contenu: Took being passed off to 3 people but the last one was easier to talk to and had a workaround to the problem of email wouldn't receive email from Nextiva. Also there was no call center background noise and it was easier to understand and less distracting.

Review.Titre: My Customer Relations Rep is the BEST
Review.Contenu: My Customer Relations Rep was great in assisting me on getting access to my many many accounts. The process is a pain, but he made it better by being patient and kind to me. It can be a hit or miss when speaking to Nextiva, make sure you have ALL the correct information before calling.

I spoke to Brandon today regarding our phone issues. He was able to help with the problem and explain what was happening.  I wish I was able to speak with him every time I called Nextiva. On another note Please UPDATE/CHANGE your customer hold music.  It becomes hard to listen to repeatedly
They were eager to assist.  We were transferred a few times before the issue was resolved.

Peppa, who helped me was FANTASTIC. She was able to help me get what I needed done.However, I didn't like that I had to take several extra steps to obtain a new phone line for a new employee. Nextiva needs a better process to add phone lines.

Review.Titre: After 3 calls to the Nextiva call…
Review.Contenu: After 3 calls to the Nextiva call center, I finally got connected with Customer Care Specialist Charles.  He was professional, courteous,  and resolved the issue in short order.  It was a pleasure working with him.  The subtraction of one star reflects the general difficulty getting timely customer support.  Lots of long hold times.  Generally speaking, I really like the versatility of the product and find your agents to be knowledgable and interested in helping.  I would highly recommend it to others but encourage investment in additional support personnel.

Update - Nextiva One reached out to review my issues.  They actively listened and quickly made improvements to the app to improve the functionality and then follow-up to make sure the updates were working.  Five stars on their effort and follow-through.  Four on the app as it still has a way to go to get where they want to go with it.Original post:The new Nextiva One application removed all the simplicity and easy of use from the old application.  No longer do I get a separate tickler notifying me of text messages vs phone calls.  They are all lumped into one notifications screen.  The has led to multiple missed text messages.  The app updates frequently and messes with my blue tooth setting cutting off access to my mic, but not the speaker.   The layout offers either too much or too little in the viewing screen and I need to bring in a technician to mess with the settings.  This should not be this difficult.

Review.Titre: It took several calls in to get someone…
Review.Contenu: It took several calls in to get someone that actually helped me to get my brand new system working.  The last person was very helpful.

The PSP person I worked with was VERY thorough and knowledgeable.  He even called back to follow.  Unfortunately for the customer, he is still not able to log into the mobile app on his phone, so we're still working through the isse.

My experience with my representative from Nextiva was fantastic. She did a great job trying to help me. The problem was with the Nextiva App. At this point there is no solution to my problem on deleting partial call logs.
Nextiva provides 24 hours technical support, which is very important for our business.

I was glad the person could remote connect to help troubleshoot the issue I was having with hearing clients and clients hearing me. I was grateful to have the issue resolved so I could get back to work asap.

(They have contacted me and are trying to accommodate all of my issues. I gave them a 4 for their effort and see how it goes from here)  I am disappointed beyond belief. What Nextiva tells you is not what you will get from pricing to function. We have a simple 3 phone 4 number system that took many hours of my time with support to set up and it still isn’t working properly. They also quoted me a price to integrate with my pos software. What a joke, they are telling me I wasn’t quoted properly by my sales person and now the price is double. If I would have just looked at the rest of these reviews it would have saved me a lot of time and money. Hopefully this review saves someone from the stress I am going through.

Nextiva was very helpful, in helping me setup my Holiday Greeting.  As well as double checking to see if I wanted to update the greeting.  The response time is a little long, but once you get someone you are taken care of!!!!

Customer service is outstanding.  Anytime I've experience an issue large or small, I receive the same level of service.  SLA's are always met.  Whether I'm calling in or emailing my Customer Account Manager turn-around has been excellent.
great customer service, i hardly have to wait, its rare that im on hold more than a few minutes waiting for tech support
The representatives are always very nice and helpful. The only downfall is the amount of time it takes to get resolution. This experience for example took almost 3 hours to restore my system.

Review.Titre: The call was answered in a reasonable…
Review.Contenu: The call was answered in a reasonable time and the problem was fixed. My only concern is that his accent was heavy and difficult to understand.
Shelly was great are getting us all the resources we needed to figure out the best way to deploy call center

Review.Titre: The tech rep helped me resolve the…
Review.Contenu: The tech rep helped me resolve the issue, although she was obviously in a hurry to end the call as soon as possible.

Review.Titre: This request was processed quickly and…
Review.Contenu: This request was processed quickly and correctly

The onboarding process went well.  The team was flexible and accommodating.   Billing was automatic which did not take into account timing of the onboarding.  More coordination between billing and service would have prevented client involvement to correct.
It was not quiet hard, they have  designed the app understandable for everybody, and mostly the things are similar as the other apps

Review.Titre: The support agent was able to help me…
Review.Contenu: The support agent was able to help me figure out the right settings for our calling center.
Support team looked into the problem in details. Problem has not been diagnosed yet and working on the case.

Review.Titre: We have been using Nextiva for years…
Review.Contenu: We have been using Nextiva for years and their service and support are excellent. Their new Nextiva One app is user friendly.

Review.Titre: The rep stayed online with me until it…
Review.Contenu: The rep stayed online with me until it was resolved. They were responsive and helpful.
Though my on-boarding experience was not the best, after a few times interacting with my account manager in the support team we have things ironed out and the service is working well.

Review.Titre: Ivan was diligent in answering my query…
Review.Contenu: Ivan was diligent in answering my query and I was satisfied with what he came up with.

The tech folk always mean well but the system is so complex and non-intuitive that even the seemingly knowledgeable and experienced ones make significant errors in setting things up.  I wanted to make Memorial Day a holiday and it didn't get set up correctly, forwarding callers inappropriately
Did just fine.  Thankfully, I did not have a complicated issue and it was resolved very quickly.
Always good feedback and instructive directions of how to solve any issues I have.

Review.Titre: Good VOIP and Fax if your own internet service is decent; confusing method to downgrade service
Review.Contenu: UPDATED POST (Jan 11, 2023):Nextiva's team escalated my matter about a week ago; I had received notice via email from them. From there, Nextiva was helpful in ultimately refunding me the amount I felt was appropriate for the unwanted-double-accounts and cancelling the unwanted account/services. I  appreciate that they ultimately fixed the situation to what I was seeking, but I wish it didn't take up so much time and energy to get their attention to this.Final thoughts: —Good/reliable online-fax services. —Good/reliable VOIP services if your own internet connection is good enough to maintain a stead/clear phone call (good internet download speed and upload speed). —Price is competitive/good. —Terrible experience in downgrading services. ORIGINAL POST (Jan 3, 2023): Service seemed fine if my connection was good. But they will not timely cancel an account even if it was created in order to downgrade a prior account. Background: Around August 2020 I had originally signed up for their mid-tier VOIP service plan (multiple phone lines and a fax). After two-years, I wanted to downgrade because we simply didn't need multiple lines.In order to downgrade, Nextiva's representative (W. Myers) had me sign up for a new account; he explained that my desired phone number would be ported to the new account and the old account would be closed. He gave me a whole analogy to explain why a second account was needed "we need to build a new house (account) and move-your old phone number into it, then tear down the old house (account)" to explain why merely downgrading my service-plan required opening a second account. First, it took him several weeks to get me the contract for the new account (caused me to get billed on the mid-tier account). He said it was Nextiva's system that wasn't ultimately delivering the contract for the new account. I finally got the new account contract in October 2022. I was told that they would be immediately cancelling the account. However, three-months later (and about 4 hour-long phone calls to their customer service), I am still having to call and email them. Keep in mind, the account that needed to be cancelled was on a month-to-month subscription. There was no required notice of cancellation nor wait-time. Nextiva: Terrible at downgrading your service or cancelling an account (even if that account was created at their suggested for the mere purpose of downgrading services). To be honest, their customer service tried to help during those hour-long calls. I received follow up emails from them stating they were tryting to cancel and to wait a little extra due to the holiday season, which I was fine with, but this problem lingering like this is unacceptable. I do not respect the sales-team there.
I forgot the guys name but he was a very big help. My app was not working on the computer and he was able to fix it.
They fixed the problem, but it was like pulling teeth.Are they not allowed to say, "We need the first AND last name."

Review.Titre: Pepa was very helpful and nice
Review.Contenu: Pepa was very helpful and nice. She walked me through the steps and answered all my questions. She did not rush me off the phone ,
Wait was long, but I got the help I needed to use the service. Customer service was nice.
I had some difficulties understanding the representative, but aside from that he was extremely helpful and was able to resolve my issue.
They always solve our problems!  Hold time is the only issue.

Review.Titre: The tech took her time and helped me…
Review.Contenu: The tech took her time and helped me set it up and fixed some things i had done incorrectly.  thanks,
Quick call answer. The goal of the call was completed. The tech could have been a bit nicer.

Review.Titre: Good support and a great helpful…
Review.Contenu: Good support and a great helpful attitude.
The rep was able to help and answer all my questions.

Review.Titre: Took a long time to get help but the…
Review.Contenu: Took a long time to get help but the tech was great! 5 stars for the tech, 3 stars for the wait to get to the tech.

Review.Titre: The level of service was great!
Review.Contenu: The response time was nice. The knowledge was great.

Review.Titre: Generally Happy -- Just a couple of issues.
Review.Contenu: I'm generally quite happy with Nextiva however lately I've been having the same problems I had with Vonage, which is what made me change to Nextiva in the first place.  That is,  I can hear the person on the other end but they can't hear me.  It's only happened a few times, but if it continues,  I will have to find another solution.  (It started slowly with Vonage as well, then over time got to be almost every call. I really hope I don't have a repeat of that.)Also,  I really wish you would make Nextiva compatible with NoMoRoBo so customers can let THEM weed out all those annoying robo calls.

Review.Titre: My experience with Nextiva support was…
Review.Contenu: My experience with Nextiva support was positive. It took a couple days of speaking with representatives to get the problem resolved. The last rep I spoke with was Michael Krutenko, he was patient and helped figure out the problem and after making a few system changes on his end was able to resolve the issue. I appreciated his time and energy in helping. Thank you!

Review.Titre: The first rep I talked to (Alex) was…
Review.Contenu: The first rep I talked to (Alex) was terrible.  He wasn’t listening to my problem and he essentially told me that it was my equipment’s fault.   I didn’t even have my equipment connected!   I had to insist on talking to a supervisor or someone else.   The next guy was great.  He fixed the problem.  Thank goodness I asked for another rep!!!

Review.Titre: Many options meant longer setup, but very happy once customization complete

Once that was understood, setup was straightforward.Voice quality is excellent with a 75/20 Mbps Uverse pipe.An issue remains with getting all the extensions in the home to ring. This seems to be due to the REN limitations on the ATA, and is being addressed with another solution.Because Nextiva is business oriented, the voicemail greeting system is a little impersonal for a home line. EDIT: Leaving my original review below for authenticity, but leaving my latest experience at the top for focus on the outcome.Ultimately was connected with a gentleman named John who took ownership of the situation. He made clear with no uncertainty that they saw an issue, were taking ownership of it, allowed me to be heard, and were immediately implementing a resolution.True to his word, they overnighted a wireless accessible device, got an engineer to connect it immediately, and only then did we discuss the reviews that were left. Accidents happen and I don't fault them for that. It was a frustrating few days working for a resolution and feeling burned. That said, push come to shove - they owned it, they apologized, they listened, they made it right, and they said they would take the situation into account for improving their policies and procedures for situations similar to this moving forward. If anything, I must say the acted with integrity here in the end. Frustrated customer turned around and I would say I feel loyalty to them after all is said and done.Original Review:Called in for help provisioning a Yealink T48G phone with upgraded Wifi capabilities. Representative goofed up and downgraded the firmware to the point the Wifi capability was eradicated. The initial solution was for me to go around and find a neighbor who would be able to assist with correcting his error. 2 hours on the phone with support and I'm told they would be able to have a replacement sent to them, they could get the Wifi functionality working, and then send me way. I was told this would take many days with 2 different deliveries between manufacturer, Nextiva, and ultimately me. This was unsatisfactory and I was told to wait 24-48 hours for a manager to escalate and come up with a better solution. 48 hours went by and no information, so I called back in. This time I was offered to use their app on my cell phone and was ridiculed for not having my phone hard wired vs using wirelessly... in the year 2020. The he then said his best solution, which was now not as effective as the first, was that he would credit my account for a shipping label. That I was to package, ship, wait days for them to attempt to fix phone, receive phone back, and then ultimately begin back where I started. When I confronted how absurd this was and that the previous solution offered was poor, but far superior - I was then told to speak to the escalations department (ei cancellations). I confronted that I never said nor insinuated that I was looking to cancel my service, but simply be set back to my original condition prior to their mishap, I was told to then wait for a call from escalations and that was their best and final solution. At this point my Wifi enabled phone is no longer Wifi enabled, my service has not been functioning as I've been paying for during this time, and I'm no closer to any solution that after my initial 2 hour conversation. I would highly suggest anyone considering this company for their services explore alternative options. The tech support team isn't trained well enough, their mid level managers explored intelligent options, but have their hands tied, and their senior level managers are dismissive and not reasonable nor fair in their problem solving endeavors.

Review.Titre: Great so far!  Easy process.  Robust controls.
Review.Contenu: So far, our experience has been great.  We received a low monthly price for our small business phone service, all the new phones were included for "free," and the phones arrived within a week and as billed.  We set up the phones today with the help of a virtual Nextiva installation consultant who walked us step-by-step through the process.  We are still waiting to port our business numbers (local, toll-free, and fax numbers) over to the new phone system, but if that goes well then we are going to be very pleased with the new system.  It is all easily customizable through the online account website, we have the control to change or modify almost everything instantly (phone tree, display on each phone, voicemail system, etc), and the many clear and helpful online video tutorials make every change super easy.  If our numbers port over without a glitch, then Nextiva is amazing.  Our new phone systems is going to be much more robust than we ever expected.
